page.title: 07Wright's Flour Mill 1
page.content: Wright's Flour Mill was founded by George Reynolds Wright.The east mill dates back to Queen Anne's time.In that time there was no electricity so the mill was worked by two water wheels.These provided power to drive seven pairs of mill stones.It was known then as Flanders Mill;renamed in the 18th century Enfield Mill.Once more in 1850 its name was changed to Ponders End Mill.For many years Ponders End Mill was one of many mills,now only two are working.In 1880 the premises were partly rebuilt and five new pairs of mill stones were added.A steam engine was installed to drive them.150 years ago the only transport for sacks was a horse drawn cart which could pull up to forty sacks (5 tonnes)>
